title: RBI Grade B - FM - FLM2 - Objective

quiz.text: __________ is referred to as a need that you want to fulfill
options: Motive
Motivator
Motivating
Motivational

quiz.text: One Nation and One Ombudsman Scheme was announced by the RBI on 5th February 2021. There are dedicated ombudsman schemes devoted to consumer grievance redressal in banking, non-bank finance companies and digital transactions, respectively, are in operation from 22 ombudsman offices of the RBI located across the country. In line with the global initiatives on consumer protection, RBI has taken various initiatives to strengthen the Grievance Redress Mechanism of regulated entities. In the same regard, ‘Centralized Receipt and Processing Centre" has been set up in which city
options: Jaipur
Mumbai
Delhi
Hyderabad
None of the above

quiz.text: All of the following might be used to improve organizational communication except __________
options: surveys and feedback
management training
filtering
TV Networks
All of the above

quiz.text: Power is the capacity of the person to give orders to another and get orders obeyed despite resistance from the other person. The response to the power of one person by another (target) can be in the following way, except ?
options: Obedience
Compliance
Conformity
Commitment
Coordination

quiz.text: During the year 1973, Satish observed a sudden surge in fuel prices. He came across news in the newspaper stating that this increase was a result of oil-producing countries imposing an oil embargo in response to the support provided by the USA and other nations to Israel during the Yom Kippur War. From the below-given options, identify the economic crisis being discussed here.
options: Oil Price Shock
Financial Recession
Global Trade Disruption
Energy Security Crisis
Middle East Conflict Crisis

quiz.text: Gordan Allport cited that leadership is affected by the traits of human beings. These traits are influenced by our childhood experiences, our current environment, and the interaction between the two. Identify the traits which build the basic foundation of the human being.
options: Cardinal Traits
Central Traits
Secondary Traits
Tertiary Traits
All of the above

quiz.text: Financial Benchmarks India Pvt. Ltd. is jointly owned by ____?
options: SEBI, RBI and IRDAI
SEBI, RBI and Indian Banks Association
RBI, Indian Banks Association and FIMMDA
SEBI, Indian Banks Association and FIMMDA
FEDAI, Indian Banks Association and FIMMDA

quiz.text: Identify the special branch of ethics, which deals with the study of controversial moral issues. IT helps to use knowledge of moral principles to present dilemmas. It deals with the practical and live issues to apply ethical principle.
options: Descriptive ethics
Applied Ethics
Prescriptive Ethics
Normative Ethics
Meta Ethics

quiz.text: According to priority sector norms, scheduled commercial banks must give 40% of their loans (measured in terms of Adjusted Net Bank Credit or ANBC) to the identified priority sectors in accordance with the RBI regulations. In the same regard, what is the PSL target for MSME ?
options: 8.5%
7.5%
4.5%
6.5%
5.5%

quiz.text: Identify X, from the options given below
options: Compensatory Justice
Commutative Justice
Retributive Justice
Communitarian Justice
Procedural Justice

quiz.text: Identify Y, form the options given below
options: Procedural Justice

quiz.text: Financial inclusion means making the financial services available to everyone at affordable costs. Under this, the services should be available for disadvantaged people and low-income groups. Thus, the main objective is to serve the basic banking services to the unreserved people in the country. This process is for achieving economic growth in the country. Also, the main idea is to bridge the gap between poor and rich people. Furthermore, it is done by getting the excess money from and serving it to the poor. The pivotal role in financial inclusion is played by the RBI. For Promoting Finanicial inclusion, RBI, in January 2006 permitted banks to use intermediaries as Business Facilitators (BF) or Business Correspondents (BC) for providing financial and banking services. ​ Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) including Regional Rural Banks (RRBs), Local Area Banks (LABs), the Payments and Small Finance Banks have been permitted to use the services of BCs. For training of BCs, RBI has launched a training programme which is known as ?
options: SUPER- A
SUPER- C
SUPER- B
SUPER- D
SUPER- E

quiz.text: Financial inclusion means making the financial services available to everyone at affordable costs. Under this, the services should be available for disadvantaged people and low-income groups. Thus, the main objective is to serve the basic banking services to the unreserved people in the country. This process is for achieving economic growth in the country. Also, the main idea is to bridge the gap between poor and rich people. Furthermore, it is done by getting the excess money from and serving it to the poor. The pivotal role in financial inclusion is played by the RBI. For Promoting Financial inclusion, RBI has launched the National Strategy for Financial Inclusion (NSFI), which sets forth the vision and key objectives of the financial inclusion policies in India to help expand and sustain the financial inclusion process at the national level through a broad convergence of action involving all the stakeholders in the financial sector. ​ What is the duration for which NSFI will be operationalized ?
options: 2020-2025
2019-2025
2019-2026
2019-2024
2021-2024

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect, with respect to NEFT
options: November 2005, The RBI introduced NEFT
The NEFT system provides for batch settlements at half-hourly intervals
The NEFT system provides real time fund transfer
NEFT has no limit - either minimum or maximum - on the amount of funds transferred
All of the above statements are incorrect

quiz.text:
From the below-given information, calculate the original cost of the machine.
ParticularsAmount
Purchase cost12,00,000
Installation expenses2,00,000
Repairing charges after installation1,00,000
Transportation of machine to factory2,00,000
  Inauguration charges15,000
options: 5,00,000
7,00,000
9,00,000
12,00,000
16,00,000

quiz.text: When messages or information is exchanged or communicated without using any spoken or written word is known as nonverbal communication. Non-verbal communication (NVC) is usually understood as the process of communication through sending and receiving wordless messages. Non-Verbal Communication can take place both in Oral and Written Communication. Hand gestures, Body language are part of non-verbal communication in Oral Communication. Even in Written Communication symbols like smileys exhibit nonverbal communication. Nonverbal communication plays a significant role in our lives, as it can improve a person’s ability to relate, engage, and establish meaningful interactions in everyday life. A better understanding of this type of communication may lead people to develop stronger relationships with others. Scientific research on nonverbal communication and behavior began with the 1872 publication of Charles Darwin's The Expression of the Emotions in Man and Animals. Since that time, abundant research has been conducted regarding types, effects, and expressions of unspoken communication and behavior. While these signals are often so subtle that we are not consciously aware of them, research has identified several different nine types of nonverbal communication. In the same regard, identify the mode of communication wherein, communication is done by the people, when they refer to their own need of personal space.
options: Oculesics
Proxemic
Kinesics
Haptic
None of the above

quiz.text: Leadership is the art of motivating a group of people to act toward achieving a common goal. In a business setting, this can mean directing workers and colleagues with a strategy to meet the company's needs. Leadership captures the essentials of being able and prepared to inspire others. Effective leadership is based upon ideas—both original and borrowed—that are effectively communicated to others in a way that engages them enough to act as the leader wants them to act. A leader inspires others to act while simultaneously directing the way that they act. They must be personable enough for others to follow their orders, and they must have the critical thinking skills to know the best way to use the resources at an organization's disposal.The Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid is a system that can be used to group like leaders into categories based on the methods that they use. This can be used to identify a manager's existing leadership style and provide a training path to the ideal leadership style required. The matrix analyses a manager’s style of leadership by the consideration of two dimensions. The managers concern for production (or the task) such as work efficiency or volume of output. The managers concern for people (or relationships) such as satisfying personal relations and establishing trust. According to Blake-Mouton Managerial Grid, a Country Club Manager has following features, except
options: Manager has a high concern to satisfy relationships, often at the expense of achieving the task objectives
Sub-ordinates are encouraged, supported and their needs are satisfied
Manager is considered as a big brother and social relationships are often given more importance
A country club manager follows accommodating style of leadership
All of the above are the features of country club manager

quiz.text: Identity the payment system discussed above in paragraph C.
options: CHIPS
CHAPS
FedWire
TARGET
America Pay

quiz.text: Currently, only 3 banks are categorized as D-SIB, they are State Bank of India, HDFC banks and ICICI bank. In order to be listed as a D-SIB, a bank needs to have assets that exceed ______ percent of the national GDP.
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: Current ratio is 4:1.Net Working Capital is Rs.30,000. Find the amount of current Assets.
options: 38,000
40,000
42,000
44,000
None of the options given above

quiz.text: The 15th Finance Commission has Empowered the Local Government, The total size of grant to the local government should be 4,36,361 crore for the period 2021-26, Commission favor a fixed amount rather than a proportion of the divisible pool of taxes to ensure greater predictability of the quantum and timing of fund flow. Of these total grants, what amount has been allocated to performance-based grants for incubation of new cities.
options: 5000 Crore
6000 Crore
7000 Crore
8000 Crore
None of the above

quiz.text: In 1999, The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) started the implementation of Basel norms in India and Basel accords or Basel norms are the international banking regulations issued by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS). The BCBS is the primary global standard setter for the prudential regulation for banks. Basel norms have provided the much need financial discipline to the Indian banks and as a result the Indian banks are contributing toward the development of Indian economy in a holistic manner. The Basel Committee has issued three sets of regulations which are known as Basel- I, II, and III. In Basel 3, Leverage or the degree of exposure toward the risk was decided by the leverage ratio, it can be defined as a ratio of which two components
options: Banks tier 2 capital to average consolidated liabilities
Banks tier 2 capital to average consolidated assets
Banks tier 1 capital to average consolidated liabilities
Banks tier 1 capital to average consolidated assets
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the boards of HDFC and HDFC Bank have approved the merger between the two institutions. The merger has made HDFC Bank, the world's _________-biggest bank by market value
options: eighth
second
tenth
fourth
sixth

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), which of the following securities can be offered by online bond providers (OBPPs) on their platforms as per the ruling of Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI)?
options: Treasury Bills
Government Securities
listed Sovereign Gold Bonds
listed municipal debt securities
All of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has barred six entities from securities markets for one year and levied penalties totalling Rs 70 lakh on them for violating insider trading norms in the matter of Shilpi Cable Technologies. Penalty for insider trading under Section 15G of the SEBI Act, 1992 ranges from ___________ or 3 times of profits out of insider trading, whichever is higher.
options: 10 lakhs to 25 Crores
5 lakhs to 5 Crores
10 lakhs to 1 Crores
50 lakhs to 25 Crores
50 lakhs to 5 Crores

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), according to a recent data released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the outstanding portfolio under education loans grew _________  to Rs 96,847 crore in 2022-23 as compared to 2021-22.
options: 12%
17%
24%
18%
35%

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the Reserve Bank released data relating to India’s International Investment Position for April-March 2022-23. Accordingly, the share of debt liabilities in total external liabilities increased to _________ in March 2023 from 49.1 per cent a year earlier.
options: 50.2 per cent
51.2 per cent
48.3 per cent
45.3 per cent
40.2 per cent

quiz.text: According to recently (In July 2023), issued draft circular by the RBI addressing the arrangements between card networks and card issuers when it comes to the issuance of debit, credit, and prepaid cards. Which of the following is not an authorized card network in India?
options: TerraPay
American Express Banking Corp
Diners Club International Ltd
MasterCard Asia/ Pacific Pte. Ltd
Visa Worldwide Pte. Limited

quiz.text: According to recently (In June), released data by the RBI, the current account balance recorded a deficit of ____________ in 2022-23 compared to a deficit of 1.2% in 2021-22 as the trade deficit widened to $265.3 billion from $189.5 billion a year ago.
options: 3.0% of GDP
2.5% of GDP
2.0% of GDP
2.1% of GDP
2.2% of GDP

quiz.text: Recently (In June), the RBI on National statistics day has launched next generation data warehouse, with the name ___________________.
options: Centralised Data Management System
